page.title: 13ECOLOGY/PONDS,STREAMS.
page.content: There is an extremely large number of {Ponds}scattered all over this country side East of{Headcorn village,}which is situated in the{LOW WEALD}of{KENT.} Some of the ponds are inaccessable and completely hidden by undergrowth, only being visible from the air. Others are found in little groups, huddled together and surrounded by trees such as{Willow}and{Ash,}or in a coppice of {Hazel}and{Chestnut.}There is hardly a farmhouse without it's pond, usually harbouring families of Ducks. They are Fresh water ponds and many contain Fish; these are frequented by Anglers of all ages, but it usual first to obtain a permit. Little{streams}like the{river Sherway}also trickle through the area from the many Springs rising out of the Greensand Ridge to the North
